iti107:0.3: The Chapter on the Holy Offering of the Teaching
iti107:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti107:2.1: “Mendicants, brahmins and houselholders are very helpful to you, as they provide you with robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
iti107:2.2: And you are very helpful to brahmins and householders, as you teach them the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And you reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.
iti107:2.3: That is how this spiritual path is lived in mutual dependence in order to cross over the flood and make a complete end of suffering.”
iti107:2.4: That is what the Buddha said.
iti107:3.3: find success in the true teaching,
iti107:5.3: place faith in the perfected ones,
iti107:6.2: the path that goes to a good place,
iti107:6.3: they delight in the heavenly realm,
iti107:6.4: enjoying all the pleasures they desire.”
iti107:7.1: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
